page.title: 07STORNOWAY SOUTH - POLICE
page.content: The{police station}is nearly 19 years old. It was officially opened on the 28th of June 1967 by Alexander Macrae, ex provost of Dingwall. He was chairman of the police committe at that time. The{first}police station in Stornoway was built in 1857. It was built in Kenneth Street. The most common crimes in 1984 were mostly thefts, and breaches of the peace. The Stornoway police station has three male cells and one female and there are two legalised cells; that's what they call cells where they can keep prisoners for a long period. Altogether there are seven cells.There are 21 policemen employed in the police station in Stornoway, 12 uniformed constables, seargents, 2 officers of the C.I.D and there is 1 officer in community involment.
